channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump administration's plans for the future of Venezuela remain unclear
item.description: President Trump has shared mixed messages about the future of Venezuela after capturing the country's president. A look at his evolving plans for Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has shared mixed messages about the future of Venezuela after capturing the country's president. A look at his evolving plans for Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Former diplomat talks about President Trump and the future of Venezuela
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks to former diplomat Tom Shannon about what the Trump administration is planning next for Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks to former diplomat Tom Shannon about what the Trump administration is planning next for Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Federal appeals court hears challenge to Trump administration's NIH funding cuts
item.description: A federal appeals court in Boston heard arguments Tuesday as the Trump administration seeks to overturn a ruling that found the NIH acted unlawfully in terminating research grants.
item.content:encoded: A federal appeals court in Boston heard arguments Tuesday as the Trump administration seeks to overturn a ruling that found the NIH acted unlawfully in terminating research grants.
item.dc:creator: Craig LeMoult

item.title: DHS wants Venezuelans to return home, but fears remain as long as Maduro regime is in power
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans have been in limbo since the Trump administration removed their temporary protected status late last year. That uncertainty has intensified as U.S. immigration officials again push for those migrants to return to Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans have been in limbo since the Trump administration removed their temporary protected status late last year. That uncertainty has intensified as U.S. immigration officials again push for those migrants to return to Venezuela.

(Image credit: José A. Alvarado Jr. for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump's plans for Venezuela's future remain unclear, the president tries to offer his party a "roadmap" for winning the midterms, European leaders express alarm at Trump's comments on Greenland.
item.content:encoded: Trump's plans for Venezuela's future remain unclear, the president tries to offer his party a "roadmap" for winning the midterms, European leaders express alarm at Trump's comments on Greenland.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: What does U.S. history tell us about what's unfolding in Venezuela?
item.description: What does history tell us about U.S. actions in Venezuela? NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Stephen Kinzer, author of the book, "Overthrow: America's Century of Regime Change from Hawaii to Iraq."
item.content:encoded: What does history tell us about U.S. actions in Venezuela? NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Stephen Kinzer, author of the book, "Overthrow: America's Century of Regime Change from Hawaii to Iraq."
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Trial of former Uvalde school police officer paused after testimony of key witness
item.description: Testimony in the trial of a former Uvalde school police officer was paused Tuesday after the prosecution was accused of withholding information after a key witness changed their testimony.
item.content:encoded: Testimony in the trial of a former Uvalde school police officer was paused Tuesday after the prosecution was accused of withholding information after a key witness changed their testimony.
item.dc:creator: Camille Phillips

item.title: California fire victims say slow insurance payouts have stalled efforts to rebuild
item.description: California fire victims say they're struggling to rebuild because insurance payouts have been slow or insufficient. Some lawmakers say home insurance is failing those facing climate change.
item.content:encoded: California fire victims say they're struggling to rebuild because insurance payouts have been slow or insufficient. Some lawmakers say home insurance is failing those facing climate change.
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: Women's para ice hockey edges closer to its own Olympic stage
item.description: When the Paralympics begin in Italy, one sport that won't be in the competition is women's para ice hockey. But after a successful World Championships, players hope it could be added in the future.
item.content:encoded: When the Paralympics begin in Italy, one sport that won't be in the competition is women's para ice hockey. But after a successful World Championships, players hope it could be added in the future.
item.dc:creator: Emily Chen-Newton

item.title: Mexican singer-songwriter Humbe completes trilogy with new album about renewal
item.description: Mexican singer-songwriter Humbe has released three albums in three years. His latest, "Dueño del Cielo," completes a trilogy started in 2023.
item.content:encoded: Mexican singer-songwriter Humbe has released three albums in three years. His latest, "Dueño del Cielo," completes a trilogy started in 2023.
item.dc:creator: Lilly Quiroz
